Failed to show image (out of memory)
Failed to show image (deep-zoom loading failed)
Add a site to begin browsing

Filters act on a given pattern and a place to search the pattern.
If the pattern matches, then the post can be hidden, removed, highlighted, or automatically bookmarked.

These filters are pattern based, and have three modes:

1. The pattern foo bar will match text that has any of the words in it. It will match foo or bar, but not foobar. Placing a * allows any character to be filled in: f*o will match both foo and foooo, but not foobar

2. Quoting your pattern with \" (like \"foo bar\") will match the text exactly. foo bar will match, but foo will not.

3. Regular expressions. /^>implying/ for example. You can use /^>ImPlYiNg/i to make the regex case insensitive. You can use Regex101 for more comprehensive explanations of your regular expressions, or as a playground for figuring out an expression. Use Javascript to test.

For country code filtering, troll country codes should be prepended with t_. A country code filter automatically implies the case insensitive flag for regex.

Actions do the following:
Hide: Replace the post with a stub. You can tap it to un-hide it.
Highlight: A colored bar of your choosing will appear on the left hand side of this post.
Remove: Remove this post. It won\'t be visible at all.
Watch: If you have the thread watcher enabled and background watching on, catalogs will be periodically checked based on your interval setting and any OP that matches the filter will be put into your bookmarks. Any catalogs loaded by the you navigating to them from the board select popup will also be checked.

Enabled filters have priority from top to bottom in your list. Filter precedence for actions is as follows:

1) Capcode or sticky
2) OP
3) Saved replies (your posts)
4) Tripcode
5) Name
6) Comment
7) ID
8) Subject
9) Country Code
10) Filename
No bookmarks cleared. Hold to remove all.
Error posting: You must wait %d seconds before posting.
Watch bookmarks when app is in the background
The interval between updates when placed in the background
Notify when threads hit the last page
Show a heads-up notification when quoted

This will make image gallery view be fullscreen with statusbar/navbar hidden

Create a folder for each thread when saving image albums
Save the image with the filename the site assigned. If disabled, save the image with the filename the uploader assigned.

Share the URL to the image instead of the image itself
Always reveal spoiler thumbnails and images
Automatically reveal spoiler images, not thumbnails

Instead of loading thumbnails, pre-loads full size images into the file cache when thumbnails should be displayed and uses them for thumbnail display. Tapping a thumbnail will load the full size image directly from the cache.

"Permission to access storage is required for browsing files.
Re-enable this permission in the app settings if you permanently disabled it."

"Swipe to change the theme. Tap the toolbar menu to change its color. Tap the checkmark button when done.
If you're on Android 10+, the sun/moon toggle selects the theme used for the day or night theme if dark mode is enabled. Setting the themes to the same will function as if dark mode is effectively off. Note that the application will restart when the theme changes."
Tap to change the accent color.

These settings may be in an unstable state. They are for testing. They may break the app and you may have to reset the app data. Use them at your own risk if you are really interested in some feature. Backup everything beforehand.
Can\'t open this thread in your browser, it\'s probably already been deleted
Can\'t send thread via NFC, it\'s already been deleted
Can\'t share this thread, it\'s already been deleted
Always open the drawer when a thread is bookmarked
Makes long-pressing on post images copy the image URL to the clipboard
Replaces certain links with more readable titles, and displays durations if applicable. If post image linking is enabled, some links will generate as images as well.
Could not save one or more images
Overwrite existing file or create a new one?

You have %1$s set to be located in a directory that uses the Storage Access Framework. This directory location cannot be exported; IT WILL BE RESET TO DEFAULT in the exported settings file! Once you import them you will have to manually set those locations in Media Settings again.
Use the new Storage Access Framework API to choose images download directory?
If you choose to use the SAF you will be able to choose an SD-card as a place to store downloaded images
Could not copy one directory\'s file into another one
Would you like to delete files in the old directory?

Files have been copied and now exist in two directories. You may want to remove files in the old directory 

"%1$s"

since you won't need them anymore. 
This operation will DELETE ALL the files in that directory, so if you had some files not related to this app you probably should do that manually.
Couldn\'t delete files in the old directory
Successfully deleted files in the old directory
Do you want to copy %1$d files from old directory to the new one?"
Move old saved files to the new directory?

Move files from 

"%1$s"

 directory to 

"%2$s"

directory? This operation may take quite some time. Once started this operation must not be canceled. 
This operation will move ALL the files, so if you had some files not related to this app you probably should do that manually.

By enabling this setting, the app will start collecting crash logs. They are NOT uploaded automatically. Crash logs only collect the stacktrace itself, app version and basic OS information. You can review and upload them manually (or delete) by clicking the \"Report\" setting.
Would you like to review and maybe send them to developers?
